message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DB. 

The paper focuses on context-aware recommendation algorithms, which are commonly studied in the information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG) communities. The paper also proposes a general factorization framework that can be applied to various linear models, which falls under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) category. The framework's ability to incorporate various types of information, such as item metadata and social networks, suggests that it may also be relevant to the social and information networks (cs.SI) category. Finally, the paper discusses the framework's scalability and applicability to real-life datasets, which relates to the database (cs.DB) category.
